#Code by Abid Ali Awan https://www.kaggle.com/kingabzpro/finding-the-bad-password/notebook

#Masks commented because there is too much data to fit in the space.

#Getting all the reviews termed positive in a single string and forming a word cloud of the string

from wordcloud import WordCloud

fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=[14, 14], facecolor = None)

text1 =''
for i in df['password_id'].values:
    text1+=i + ' '

x, y = np.ogrid[:300, :300]

#mask = (x - 150) ** 2 + (y - 150) ** 2 > 130 ** 2
#mask = 255 * mask.astype(int)

wc1 = WordCloud(width = 800, height = 800,background_color="lightgreen",min_font_size = 10,\
    repeat=True)
wc1.generate(text1)

ax1.axis("off")
ax1.imshow(wc1, interpolation="bilinear")
ax1.set_title('Password ID',fontsize=20);

text2 =''
for i in df['username'].values:
    text2+=i + ' '

x, y = np.ogrid[:300, :300]

#mask = (x - 150) ** 2 + (y - 150) ** 2 > 130 ** 2
#mask = 255 * mask.astype(int)


wc2 = WordCloud(width = 800, height = 800,background_color="salmon",min_font_size = 10,\
    repeat=True)
wc2.generate(text2)

ax2.axis("off")
ax2.imshow(wc2, interpolation="bilinear")
ax2.set_title('Username',fontsize=20);


plt.show()

source.5d28af23:
from wordcloud import WordCloud, STOPWORDS
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
nlp = spacy.load("en_core_web_lg")  # make sure to use larger model!
tokens = nlp("I'll probably be hated for this but here goes. Multiple changes denotes insecurity. In my opinion all scream Hey look at me. I imagine attention is a good thing. But only for the right reason. What validate you? Some are in excess of a thousand dollars, to request what is amazing. I had the same thoughts about her. Nothing more attractive than ones NATURAL BEAUTY. Someone will definitely be fired over this, and very well should be.")

newText =''
for word in tokens:
 if word.pos_ in ['ADJ', 'NOUN']:
  newText = " ".join((newText, word.text.lower()))

wordcloud = WordCloud(stopwords=STOPWORDS, colormap='Set3', background_color="black").generate(newText)
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.show()
source.bf21933f:
Meinungsmaschinen im Internet - Social Bots

"Maschinengesteuerte Fake-Profile überschwemmen das Internet mit gestreuten Informationen und versuchen so, Menschen zu beeinflussen. Sie werden als Social Bots bezeichnet. Wie funktionieren sie und warum sind sie gefährlich?" Von Eva Wolfangel - 13.12.2016 https://www.stuttgarter-zeitung.de/inhalt.social-bots-meinungsmaschinen-im-internet.69c3f2b7-fe85-4e3e-8f43-7883a8d0daab.html
